title: French music awards Les Flammes shines light on criticized 'urban music' label
summary: The Les Flammes ceremony, to be held on Thursday evening, aims to highlight the diversity of pop music.

title: Glide bombs: Russia's 'ultimate weapon' or a sign of Ukraine's under-equipment?
summary: Russia's military seems to have found a way to upset the balance between firepower and defensive capabilities with these inexpensively improved Soviet-era bombs.

title: In EU speech, Macron says Europe is 'mortal' and 'can die'
summary: A few weeks ahead of the June European elections, the French president outlined his vision of Europe in a speech at the Sorbonne university in Paris.

title: Debate on youth violence: 'Repression is a popular idea, but it's a failure'
summary: Not only is the portrayal of violent and uncontrollable youth a longstanding political myth, but the many repressive policies adopted over the past two centuries have further destabilized vulnerable young people and their families.

title: French Palme d'Or winner Laurent Cantet dies
summary: His agent Isabelle de la Patelliere said the filmmaker died of illness in Paris.

title: US campus protests for Gaza turn into electoral trap for Biden
summary: Demonstrations and sit-ins against the war in Gaza are increasing at universities across the country. Joe Biden risks alienating both part of the youth and a segment of the Jewish vote.

title: Dubai underwater: climate change has amplified historic rains
summary: The torrential rains that killed 24 people in the UAE and Oman on April 15 and 16 were 10% to 40% more intense as a result of climate change, according to a World Weather Attribution study.

title: Harvey Weinstein's sex crime conviction overturned by New York court
summary: The New York court found the trial judge unfairly allowed testimony against Weinstein based on allegations that weren't part of the case.

title: Israeli hostage families fear they are being forgotten
summary: More than six months after October 7, 130 people, mostly Israelis, are still being held by Hamas in the Gaza Strip. Negotiations for their release appear to be at a complete standstill, compounding a simmering political crisis.

title: 'For Meloni's right, anti-fascism is a divisive factor'
summary: The cancellation of writer Antonio Scurati's speech for the April 25 celebrations that mark the anniversary of liberation from Nazism and Fascism in Italy is seen as an act of censorship, reawakening a quarrel over the country's history.

title: US reinstates open access internet rules rescinded under Trump
summary: The US Federal Communications Commission on Thursday restored 'net neutrality' rules that prevent broadband internet providers from favoring some sites and apps over others.

title: Thousands of flights canceled in France due to planned strike
summary: A decision by the biggest air traffic controller union SNCTA on Wednesday to withdraw their strike call came too late to avoid mass cancelations.

title: Haiti's transitional council sworn in after PM Henry's resignation
summary: The 9-member Transitional Presidential Council has replaced former prime minister Ariel Henry, who resigned as promised in March, to lead gang violence-stricken Haiti.  Their main task is to get the country ready for elections in 2026, the first since 2016.

title: Paris's Moulin Rouge windmill blades collapse overnight
summary: The wings of the iconic French landmark fell off overnight for reasons not yet known. No injuries were reported.

title: 2024 EU elections: French far right ditches candidate who made racist remarks
summary: In 2017, Saidali Boina Hamissi referred to Comorians as 'vermin' and 'cockroaches.' The government has also accused him of being 'sexist,' a conspiracy theorist and a Putin 'admirer.'

title: Former resident of Nir Oz kibbutz lifts veil on conditions of her children's detention in Gaza
summary: In her newly published book, Hadas Kalderon revisits the captivity of her daughter, Sahar, 17, and son, Erez, 12, who were held hostage by Hamas for almost two months.

title: French 'The Voice' star says he 'simulated suicide' to scare girlfriend
summary: Kendji Girac was seriously injured by a gunshot this week. Investigators have ruled out anyone else being involved.

title: Nestlé destroys two million bottles of Perrier over bacterial contamination
summary: In an order dated April 19, the company received formal notice to 'immediately suspend' operations at one of its seven water extraction sites in Vergèze, in southern France.
